Content: Summarizing the player ''sees'' only within a small part of the game,
while everything else is partially or completly obscured by a
fog-of-war. The server would have to maintain two different game states
for every client (including) AI for this to work out perfectly. So
instead it will be the clienst duty to collect and process information.
It can only request information about the things directly visible to
it. This also implies that foreign entities can be querried for
abstract information, like rough location and data. Precise information
has to be stored by the client and should in general not be relevant.
